channel.link:
/Recent content onHugo -- gohugo.ioSat, 23 Feb 2019 00:00:00 +0000
Add WSL metadata for ntfs/notes/add-wsl-metadata-for-ntfs/Sat, 23 Feb 2019 00:00:00 +0000/notes/add-wsl-metadata-for-ntfs/sudo vim /etc/wsl.conf add… [automount] options = "metadata"
Add serial port access to a user for arduino on arch/notes/add-serial-port-access-to-a-user-for-arduino-on-arch/Thu, 13 Dec 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/add-serial-port-access-to-a-user-for-arduino-on-arch/To allow access to the serial port device for arduino, etc., add the user to the uucp group via: sudo usermod -a -G uucp <somerandomuser> From: https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?id=122180
Make git ignore executable permissions/notes/make-git-ignore-executable-permissions/Tue, 11 Dec 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/make-git-ignore-executable-permissions/To globally disable git from watching changes to executable permissions use: git config --global core.filemode false Of course to just revert executable permissions on folders and subfolders: find . -type d -exec chmod a+rwx {} \; find . -type f -exec chmod a+rw {} \; From: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1580596/how-do-i-make-git-ignore-file-mode-chmod-changes
Setup platformio on arch/notes/setup-platformio-on-arch/Sat, 01 Dec 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/setup-platformio-on-arch/Just notes for my system using an Uno board… packer python2-pip sudo pip2 install -U platformio platformio init platformio platform install atmelavr
Brother MFC-8710DW Arch Setup/notes/brother-mfc-8710dw-arch-setup/Tue, 20 Nov 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/brother-mfc-8710dw-arch-setup/Ok, not a setup…just some drivers that worked…. packer brother-brgenml1 From https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/brother-brgenml1
Decrypt duplicati config/notes/decrypt-duplicati-aes-config/Mon, 22 Oct 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/decrypt-duplicati-aes-config/mono /opt/duplicati-latest/SharpAESCrypt.exe d <passwd> \ data-4hrs-duplicati-config.json.aes data-4hrs-duplicati-config.json
Block all IP only requests on nginx/notes/nginx-block-all-ip-addresses/Sun, 02 Sep 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/nginx-block-all-ip-addresses/server { listen 80; # server_name 8.8.8.8;# catch ip address server_name "~^[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}$"; # catch ip address deny all; } From https://www.reddit.com/r/nginx/comments/3m1qbd/allow_all_domain_names_but_not_ip/
Remove IP blocked by DenyHosts/notes/remove-ip-blocked-by-denyhosts/Fri, 03 Aug 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/remove-ip-blocked-by-denyhosts/Wow, this is annoying…. sudo service denyhosts stop # or whatever sudo vim /etc/hosts.deny sudo vim /var/lib/denyhosts/hosts sudo vim /var/lib/denyhosts/hosts-restricted sudo vim /var/lib/denyhosts/hosts-root sudo vim /var/lib/denyhosts/hosts-valid sudo vim /var/lib/denyhosts/users-hosts sudo vim /var/lib/denyhosts/allowed-hosts # optionally add here sudo service denyhosts start From https://inrg.soe.ucsc.edu/howto-unblock-an-ip-thats-been-blocked-by-denyhosts/
Change the from line in the Alpine email client/notes/change-from-line-in-alpine-email-client/Wed, 01 Aug 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/change-from-line-in-alpine-email-client/From Alpine’s [M]AIN MENU, choose [S]etup, then [C]onfig. Move down to the Customized Headers option. Press “A Add Value”. Use the format: From: "Jeff Smith" <jeff@jeffsmithdomain.com> From: https://www.washington.edu/alpine/faq/config.html
List all kde qbus shortcuts/notes/list-all-kde-qbus-shortcuts/Fri, 06 Jul 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/list-all-kde-qbus-shortcuts/List all: qdbus org.kde.kglobalaccel /component/kwin org.kde.kglobalaccel.Component.shortcutNames Execute: qdbus org.kde.kglobalaccel /component/kwin org.kde.kglobalaccel.Component.invokeShortcut shortcutName
ERROR: One or more PGP signatures could not be verified when using AUR/notes/error-one-or-more-pgp-signatures-could-not-be-verified-when-using-aur/Fri, 22 Jun 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/error-one-or-more-pgp-signatures-could-not-be-verified-when-using-aur/Assuming you trust the dev… gpg --recv-keys <key-id>
Kernel panic - not syncing: no working init found/notes/kernel-panic-not-syncing-no-working-init-found/Fri, 22 Jun 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/kernel-panic-not-syncing-no-working-init-found/Basic steps… mount /dev/sda2 /mnt mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/boot arch-chroot /mnt # or manjaro-chroot mkinitcpio -p linux grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg exit umount -R /mnt reboot From: https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?id=192296
KDE kwin with nvidia drivers crashes on switching desktops/notes/kde-kwin-with-nvidia-drivers-crashes-on-switching-desktops/Sun, 10 Jun 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/kde-kwin-with-nvidia-drivers-crashes-on-switching-desktops/Try disabling Desktop Switch On-Screen Display in KDE settings (Desktop Behavior > Virtual Desktops > Switching)
Install EDUP EP-DB1607 on Arch/notes/install-edup-ep-db1607-on-arch/Sat, 02 Jun 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/install-edup-ep-db1607-on-arch/To install drivers for: EDUP EP-DB1607 Wireless Usb Adapter ac600 grab drivers from AUR: packer rtl8821au-dkms-git
The data connection could not be established: EHOSTUNREACH - No route to host/notes/the-data-connection-could-not-be-established-ehostunreach-no-route-to-host/Fri, 01 Jun 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/the-data-connection-could-not-be-established-ehostunreach-no-route-to-host/Specify passive port range in ftp config and open the same range in firewall. From: https://serverfault.com/questions/566593/vsftpd-the-data-connection-could-not-be-established-ehostunreach-no-route-t
Check and install updates via terminal on OSX/notes/check-and-install-updates-via-terminal-on-osx/Sun, 22 Apr 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/check-and-install-updates-via-terminal-on-osx/List: softwareupdate -l Install: sudo softwareupdate -ia From: http://osxdaily.com/2011/01/13/install-mac-os-x-software-updates
Find and replace file text recursively/notes/find-and-replace-file-text-recursively/Sun, 01 Apr 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/find-and-replace-file-text-recursively/find . -type f -name "*food*" -exec sed -i 's/taco/pizza/g' {} +
Simple ssh login email notification/notes/simple-ssh-login-email-notification/Wed, 21 Mar 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/simple-ssh-login-email-notification/echo -n 'ALERT - Shell Login (a-server) on:' `date` `who` | mail -s "Alert: Shell Login from `who | cut -d"(" -f2 | cut -d")" -f1`" admin@google.com
Setup certbot to install nginx ssl on Ubuntu 16.04/notes/setup-certbot-to-install-nginx-ssl-on-ubuntu-16.04/Thu, 15 Mar 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/setup-certbot-to-install-nginx-ssl-on-ubuntu-16.04/Update firewall. Run… sudo add-apt-repository ppa:certbot/certbot sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install python-certbot-nginx sudo certbot --nginx -d example.com -d www.example.com sudo certbot renew --dry-run From: https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-secure-nginx-with-let-s-encrypt-on-ubuntu-16-04
wmctrl/notes/wmctrl/Sat, 03 Mar 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/wmctrl/wmctrl -l list windows wmctrl -d list desktops wmctrl -c <win> close window wmctrl -r <win> -t <desk> move window to desktop
Really really quick postgres install on ubuntu 16.04/notes/really-quick-postgres-install-on-ubuntu/Fri, 02 Mar 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/really-quick-postgres-install-on-ubuntu/sudo apt-get install postgresql postgresql-contrib sudo -u postgres psql ALTER USER postgres PASSWORD '123456'; \q
Install KDE Image Menu (Kim) on Linux/notes/install-kde-image-menu-kim-on-linux/Sat, 24 Feb 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/install-kde-image-menu-kim-on-linux/Do the following… cd ~ && wget http://bouveyron.free.fr/kim/release/kim4-0.9.5.tar.gz && tar zxvf kim4-0.9.5.tar.gz Run: sudo cp ~/kim4/src/kim_*.desktop /usr/share/kservices5/ServiceMenus/ sudo cp ~/kim4/src/bin/kim_* /usr/bin/ sudo mkdir /usr/share/kim sudo cp ~/kim4/COPYING /usr/share/kim/kim_about.txt sudo mkdir /usr/share/kim/slideshow/ sudo cp ~/kim4/src/slideshow/* /usr/share/kim/slideshow/ sudo mkdir /usr/share/kim/gallery sudo cp ~/kim4/src/gallery/* /usr/share/kim/gallery From: http://www.ubuntubuzz.com/2016/05/how-to-install-kim-kde-image-menu-in.html
Update mirrors on manjaro linux/notes/update-mirrors-on-manjaro-linux/Wed, 21 Feb 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/update-mirrors-on-manjaro-linux/sudo pacman-mirrors --fasttrack && sudo pacman -Syyu
Simple nginx path redirect/notes/simple-nginx-path-redirect/Fri, 02 Feb 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/simple-nginx-path-redirect/Add a similar entry to the server block… rewrite ^/knowledge/(.*)$ /content/knowledge/$1 permanent; rewrite ^/knowledge /content/knowledge permanent;
Sparkjava or tomcat slow to start on cloud VM/notes/sparkjava-or-tomcat-slow-to-start-on-cloud-vm/Wed, 24 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/sparkjava-or-tomcat-slow-to-start-on-cloud-vm/There might not be enough entropy from /dev/random causing blocking. Use a software solution like Haveged. Install haveged on ubuntu: sudo apt-get install haveged Check entropy on linux with: cat /proc/sys/kernel/random/entropy_avail
nmap/notes/nmap/Sat, 13 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/nmap/## Commands nmap 192.168.10.1 scan a host nmap 192.168.10.1/24 scan a subnet nmap 192.168.10.1-50 scan a range nmap 192.168.10.1 -sV daemon version detection nmap 192.168.10.1 -O --osscan-guess OS detection
Create local iso repository on XenServer/notes/create-local-iso-repository-on-xenserver/Tue, 09 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/create-local-iso-repository-on-xenserver/From the server console: mkdir -p /var/opt/xen/iso_import xe sr-create name-label="MyISORepository" type=iso device-config:location=/var/opt/xen/iso_import/ device-config:legacy_mode=true content-type=iso wget <something> -P /var/opt/xen/iso_import From: https://discussions.citrix.com/topic/250684-import-iso-image-to-xenserver/
iftop/notes/iftop/Tue, 02 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000/notes/iftop/## Commands sudo iftop use default interface sudo iftop -i wlp2s0 use specified interface sudo iftop -n disable hostname lookup sudo iftop -P show ports sudo iftop -p promiscuous mode
My Dogs/dogs/Mon, 01 Jan 2018 00:00:00 +0000/dogs/Rosie Chopper & Toby Captain, Chopper & Toby Bebe & Toby Bella Dot Brownie & Bebe Dot, Bella & Bebe Dot, Bella & Bebe
Rename a S3 bucket/notes/rename-a-s3-bucket/Sat, 30 Dec 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/rename-a-s3-bucket/You cant. Create a new one and copy the contents… aws s3 mb s3://new.jeffsmithdev.com aws s3 sync s3://old.jeffsmithdev.com s3://new.jeffsmithdev.com aws s3 rb --force s3://old.jeffsmithdev.com
Install imapsync under WSL/notes/install-imapsync-under-wsl/Sat, 09 Dec 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/install-imapsync-under-wsl/Using Ubu 16.04… sudo apt-get install libssl-dev makepasswd rcs perl-doc libio-tee-perl git libmail-imapclient-perl libdigest-md5-file-perl libterm-readkey-perl libfile-copy-recursive-perl build-essential make automake libunicode-string-perl libauthen-ntlm-perl libcrypt-ssleay-perl libdigest-hmac-perl libfile-copy-recursive-perl libio-compress-perl libio-socket-inet6-perl libio-socket-ssl-perl libio-tee-perl libmodule-scandeps-perl libnet-ssleay-perl libpar-packer-perl libreadonly-perl libterm-readkey-perl libtest-pod-perl libtest-simple-perl libunicode-string-perl liburi-perl libdata-uniqid-perl libtest-mockobject-perl cpanminus sudo cpanm JSON::WebToken Test::MockObject Unicode::String Data::Uniqid Crypt::OpenSSL::RSA Dist::CheckConflicts JSON::WebToken::Crypt::RSA Sys::MemInfo git clone git://github.com/imapsync/imapsync.git cd imapsync mkdir dist sudo make install From http://zero-configuration.com/2016/12/31/install-use-imapsync-ubuntu-16-04/ with a few packages added by me
Get CPU information via terminal on Linux/notes/get-cpu-information-via-terminal-on-linux/Sun, 19 Nov 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/get-cpu-information-via-terminal-on-linux/full info: cat /proc/cpuinfo or search info via: cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep 'model name' | uniq
Enable git debugging on linux and windows/notes/enable-git-debugging-on-linux-and-windows/Wed, 15 Nov 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/enable-git-debugging-on-linux-and-windows/linux: export GIT_TRACE_PACKET=1 export GIT_TRACE=1 export GIT_CURL_VERBOSE=1 windows: set GIT_TRACE_PACKET=1 set GIT_TRACE=1 set GIT_CURL_VERBOSE=1
Up arrow to autocomplete from history in bash/notes/up-arrow-to-autocomplete-in-bash/Thu, 09 Nov 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/up-arrow-to-autocomplete-in-bash/Edit .inputrc and add: ## arrow up "\e[A":history-search-backward ## arrow down "\e[B":history-search-forward From: https://askubuntu.com/questions/59846/bash-history-search-partial-up-arrow
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly pushing to github/notes/fatal-the-remote-end-hung-up-unexpectedly-pushing-to-github/Tue, 07 Nov 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/fatal-the-remote-end-hung-up-unexpectedly-pushing-to-github/You need to increase the ssh/http buffers: git config --global http.postBuffer 524288000 git config --global ssh.postBuffer 524288000 From: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15240815/git-fatal-the-remote-end-hung-up-unexpectedly
git and hg clone with full windows path and ssh login/notes/git-and-hg-clone-with-full-windows-path-and-ssh-login/Mon, 06 Nov 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/git-and-hg-clone-with-full-windows-path-and-ssh-login/git uses a single slash before path as in: dev.jeffsmithdev.com:62/C/repos/git/archived/example hg uses a double slash before path as in: dev.jeffsmithdev.com:62//C/repos/hg/archived/example
nmon/notes/nmon/Thu, 02 Nov 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/nmon/``` Shortcuts c cpu k kernel n network N NFS m memory d disk v verbose output j file system t top processes ````
Run parallel ssh command with hosts file/notes/run-parallel-ssh-command-with-hosts-file/Mon, 23 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/run-parallel-ssh-command-with-hosts-file/Parallel ssh to update ubuntu servers… pssh -h $HOME/bin/pssh-hosts -t 180 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get -y upgrade'
top/notes/top/Mon, 23 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/top/## Shortcuts 1 toggle showing all cpu cores s change update interval u show user processes R sort by PID P sort by CPU M sort by RAM c toggle full path k kill a process via PID w save modified
Run duplicati as user/notes/run-duplicati-as-user/Sun, 22 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/run-duplicati-as-user/systemctl --user start duplicati
KDE mouse acceleration too fast/notes/kde-mouse-acceleration-too-fast/Thu, 19 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/kde-mouse-acceleration-too-fast/KDE setttings doesn’t affect mouse acceleration, so we use xinput. Get the mouse id: xinput list Get all the props for the mouse: xinput list-props 14 Set the acceleration property. Value may need to be adjusted. xinput set-prop 14 669 -1 From: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/90572/how-can-i-set-mouse-sensitivity-not-just-mouse-acceleration
You need to install XCode 5.0.0/notes/you-need-to-install-xcode-5.0.0/Sat, 14 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/you-need-to-install-xcode-5.0.0/Run… sudo /usr/bin/xcode-select -switch /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer From: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31554125/attempt-to-install-qt-on-os-x-gives-you-need-to-install-xcode-5-0-0-but-this
Enable ssh server in WSL (i.e. window's bash)/notes/enable-ssh-server-in-wsl-i.e.-windows-bash/Wed, 11 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/enable-ssh-server-in-wsl-i.e.-windows-bash/Besides installing the server via: sudo apt-get install openssh-server you need to edit the sshd config and set UsePrivilegeSeparation no then a full restart: sudo service ssh --full-restart From: https://superuser.com/questions/1111591/how-can-i-ssh-into-bash-on-ubuntu-on-windows-10/1114162#1114162
Edit grub video resolution/notes/edit-grub-video-resolution/Tue, 10 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/edit-grub-video-resolution/Change grub resolution: sudo subl /etc/default/grub Edit (run videotest from grub via c to see supported) GRUB_GFXMODE=1024x768x32 Rebuild grub with this or equiv sudo grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg In the same file you can change the default text resolution by appending the res to this line GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet resume=UUID=75a2dd2e-c8d0-4400-a8c8-182ae551cb8d video=1600x900" Rebuild grub
Fix Teamviewer doesn't launch on arch/notes/fix-teamviewer-doesnt-launch-on-arch/Tue, 10 Oct 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/fix-teamviewer-doesnt-launch-on-arch/Steps… Download https://archive.archlinux.org/packages/l/lib32-freetype2/lib32-freetype2-2.8-2-x86_64.pkg.tar.xz Move to the folder you downloaded the package. sudo pacman -U lib32-freetype2-2.8-2-x86_64.pkg.tar.xz From: https://bbs.archlinux.org/viewtopic.php?id=230675
Change visudo editor from nano to vim/notes/change-visudo-editor-from-nano-to-vim/Tue, 19 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/change-visudo-editor-from-nano-to-vim/sudo update-alternatives --config editor
Jetbrains toolbox opens to blank window/notes/jetbrains-toolbox-opens-to-blank-window/Mon, 18 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/jetbrains-toolbox-opens-to-blank-window/Launch with arg: --disable-seccomp-filter-sandbox From: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/359236/jetbrains-toolbox-loads-to-a-blank-screen
Open in Guake python script for Nautilus/notes/open-in-guake-python-script-for-nautilus/Wed, 13 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/open-in-guake-python-script-for-nautilus/#!/usr/bin/env python import os, subprocess """ Summary: This is a Nautilus script to right click on an item and open in Guake. It tries to be as simple as possible. You need to select a file or folder for this to work. Tested: Arch & python 3 Install: cd .local/share/nautilus/scripts/ vi open_in_guake.py chmod +x open_in_guake.py restart nautilus """ cur_dir = os.getcwd() if os.path.isfile(cur_dir): cur_dir = os.path.dirname(cur_dir) subprocess.call([ u'guake', u'--execute-command=%s' % 'bash', u'--new-tab=%s' % cur_dir, u'--show', u'--rename-current-tab=%s' % os.
Change gnome desktop background color via terminal/notes/change-gnome-desktop-background-color-via-terminal/Tue, 05 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/change-gnome-desktop-background-color-via-terminal/gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.background picture-uri '' gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.background primary-color "#666"
Change gnome 3 desktop icon size/notes/change-gnome-3-desktop-icon-size/Sat, 02 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/change-gnome-3-desktop-icon-size/Other options didn’t work. gsettings set org.gnome.nautilus.icon-view default-zoom-level 'small'
Disable animation in gnome 3/notes/disable-animation-in-gnome-3/Sat, 02 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/disable-animation-in-gnome-3/Run then log out and in: gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface enable-animations false
The QT_QPA_PLATFORMTHEME environment variable is not set correctly/notes/the-qt_qpa_platformtheme-environment-variable-is-not-set-correctly/Fri, 01 Sep 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/the-qt_qpa_platformtheme-environment-variable-is-not-set-correctly/Set environment variable in /etc/environment and add the following line: QT_QPA_PLATFORMTHEME=qt5ct Restart the system From https://github.com/SwagArch/swagarch-build/issues/6

I dont know why this works.
Sync imap accounts with imapsync/notes/sync-imap-accounts-with-imapsync/Thu, 24 Aug 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/sync-imap-accounts-with-imapsync/Arch AUR handles all perl requirements. Install: packer imapsync Run: imapsync \ --host1 imap.gmail.com -port1 993 --ssl1 --user1 fatty@gmail.com --password1 11111111111111 --delete2 \ --host2 outlook.office365.com -port2 993 --ssl2 --user2 fatty@ms.com --password2 22222222222 --delete2

Convert mercurial repository to git/notes/convert-mercurial-repository-to-git/Wed, 16 Aug 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/convert-mercurial-repository-to-git/Clone fast-export locally to use clone existing new repos or init setup python mercurial via virtualenv and pip in new repos using env run: ~/fast-export/hg-fast-export.sh -r /home/fatty/local/dev/iq-code/sexy-www/ -A user-map.txt git checkout HEAD…done
Clone all public user repositories with bash/notes/clone-all-public-user-repositories-with-bash/Mon, 14 Aug 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/clone-all-public-user-repositories-with-bash/USER=YOURUSERNAME; PAGE=1 curl "https://api.github.com/users/$USER/repos?page=$PAGE&per_page=100" | grep -e 'git_url*' | cut -d \" -f 4 | xargs -L1 git clone From https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19576742/how-to-clone-all-repos-at-once-from-github

Configure i3 to navigate like vim/notes/configure-i3-to-navigate-like-vim/Thu, 10 Aug 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/configure-i3-to-navigate-like-vim/Edit .config/i3/config and add: # change focus bindsym $mod+h focus left bindsym $mod+j focus down bindsym $mod+k focus up bindsym $mod+l focus right # split in horizontal orientation bindsym $mod+Shift+v split h # split in vertical orientation bindsym $mod+v split v From https://faq.i3wm.org/question/2294/vim-and-keybinds.1.html

Generate cloudfront ssl certificates/notes/generate-cloudfront-ssl-certificates/Mon, 31 Jul 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/generate-cloudfront-ssl-certificates/Basically… Generate csr openssl req \ -sha256 \ -new -newkey \ rsa:2048 -nodes \ -keyout www.jeffsmithdev.net.key \ -out www.jeffsmithdev.net.csr Download certs & prepare cat COMODORSADomainValidationSecureServerCA.crt > chain.crt cat www_JeffSmithDev_net.crt > ServerCertificate.cer Upload aws iam upload-server-certificate --server-certificate-name JeffSmithDev-net --certificate-body file://ServerCertificate.cer --private-key file://www.jeffsmithdev.net.key --certificate-chain file://chain.crt --path /cloudfront/ssl/ List aws iam list-server-certificates Delete aws iam delete-server-certificate --server-certificate-name JeffSmithDev-net From https://bryce.fisher-fleig.org/blog/setting-up-ssl-on-aws-cloudfront-and-s3/

Setup bitbucket hg project with new key/notes/setup-bitbucket-project-hg-with-new-key/Mon, 03 Jul 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/setup-bitbucket-project-hg-with-new-key/Not exact steps but basically… CREATE AND USE NEW SSL KEY ssh-keygen -f ~/.ssh/tallymywork -C "tallymywork" Edit the ~/.ssh/config file. Host tallymywork HostName bitbucket.org User hg IdentityFile ~/.ssh/tallymywork pbcopy < ~/.ssh/tallymywork.pub ssh-add ~/.ssh/tallymywork ssh-add -l UPDATE .hgrc ssh://hg@tallymywork/tallymywork/tallymywork.bitbucket.org CLONE BLANK PROJECT hg clone ssh://hg@thoughtlogix/thoughtlogix/tallymywork

Store dotfiles in git repository/notes/store-dotfiles-in-git/Fri, 10 Feb 2017 00:00:00 +0000/notes/store-dotfiles-in-git/Content hacked with mods from Atlassian Setup: git init --bare $HOME/.dotfiles alias dotfiles='/usr/bin/git --git-dir=$HOME/.dotfiles/ --work-tree=$HOME' dotfiles config --local status.showUntrackedFiles no echo "alias dotfiles='/usr/bin/git --git-dir=$HOME/.dotfiles/ --work-tree=$HOME'" >> $HOME/.bashrc Add: config status config add .vimrc config commit -m "Add vimrc" config add .bashrc config commit -m "Add bashrc" Remote (change to actual ssh): git remote add origin https://someRandomFatGuy@bitbucket.org/someRandomFatGuy/dotfiles.git Push: git push Clone: git clone --bare https://someRandomFatGuy@bitbucket.org/someRandomFatGuy/dotfiles.git $HOME/.dotfiles function dotfiles { /usr/bin/git --git-dir=$HOME/.

Basic TCP/IP sysctl hardening/notes/basic-tcpip-sysctl-hardening/Tue, 21 Jun 2016 00:00:00 +0000/notes/basic-tcpip-sysctl-hardening/#### ipv4 networking and equivalent ipv6 parameters #### ## TCP SYN cookie protection (default) ## helps protect against SYN flood attacks ## only kicks in when net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog is reached net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies = 1 ## protect against tcp time-wait assassination hazards ## drop RST packets for sockets in the time-wait state ## (not widely supported outside of linux, but conforms to RFC) net.ipv4.tcp_rfc1337 = 1 ## sets the kernels reverse path filtering mechanism to value 1 (on) ## will do source validation of the packet's recieved from all the interfaces on the machine ## protects from attackers that are using ip spoofing methods to do harm net.
Basic iptables firewall on ubuntu server/notes/basic-iptables-firewall-on-ubuntu-server/Tue, 21 Jun 2016 00:00:00 +0000/notes/basic-iptables-firewall-on-ubuntu-server/For Ubuntu… IPT="/sbin/iptables" # Flush old rules, old custom tables $IPT --flush $IPT --delete-chain # Set default policies for all three default chains $IPT -P INPUT ACCEPT $IPT -P FORWARD ACCEPT $IPT -P OUTPUT ACCEPT # Enable free use of loopback interfaces $IPT -A INPUT -i lo -j ACCEPT $IPT -A OUTPUT -o lo -j ACCEPT # All TCP sessions should begin with SYN $IPT -A INPUT -p tcp ! --syn -m state --state NEW -s 0.

My .conkyrc/notes/my-conkyrc/Tue, 10 May 2016 00:00:00 +0000/notes/my-conkyrc/My conky config hacked together over the years (using old format)… ############################################## # conky configuration ############################################## ############################################## # Settings ############################################## background no use_xft yes xftfont Liberation Sans:size=9 xftalpha 1 update_interval 1.0 total_run_times 0 own_window yes own_window_type normal own_window_transparent yes own_window_transparent yes own_window_hints undecorated,sticky,skip_taskbar,skip_pager,below own_window_argb_visual yes own_window_argb_value 100 double_buffer yes minimum_size 600 maximum_width 300 draw_shades no draw_outline no draw_borders no draw_graph_borders no default_color ffffff default_shade_color ffffff default_outline_color ffffff alignment top_left gap_x -350 gap_y 0 no_buffers yes uppercase no cpu_avg_samples 2 override_utf8_locale no ############################################## # Output ############################################## TEXT ${font roboto:bold:size=10} ${time %A}, ${time %B} ${time %e}, ${time %Y} $alignr ${time %I:%M %P} ${hr} ${font roboto:bold:size=8}INT IP: $alignr ${addr enp11s0} ${font roboto:bold:size=8}EXT IP:$alignr${execi 3600 dig +short myip.

Simple sql-server creation script/notes/simple-sql-server-creation-script/Fri, 26 Feb 2016 00:00:00 +0000/notes/simple-sql-server-creation-script/Create db, login and user…. --drop database mydb; --drop user myuser; --drop login myuser; CREATE DATABASE [mydb] GO ALTER DATABASE mydb MODIFY FILE ( NAME = N'mydb' , SIZE = 102400KB , MAXSIZE = UNLIMITED, FILEGROWTH = 102400KB ) GO ALTER DATABASE mydb MODIFY FILE ( NAME = N'mydb_log' , SIZE = 1024KB , MAXSIZE = UNLIMITED , FILEGROWTH = 10%) GO USE [mydb] CREATE LOGIN myuser WITH PASSWORD = N'xxxxxxxxx', CHECK_POLICY = OFF, CHECK_EXPIRATION = OFF; GO CREATE USER myuser FROM LOGIN [myuser]; exec sp_addrolemember 'db_owner', 'mydb'; GO

About Me/about/Mon, 01 Jan 0001 00:00:00 +0000/about/I work as the Director of IT at infoQuant where I manage product deployments and perform software development. As time permits, I provide freelance web development and consulting. When not working, I still get my geek on with arduino and other maker projects. Basically, I enjoy creating things. You can reach me via github and linkedin. — Jeff -----BEGIN GEEK CODE BLOCK----- Version: 3.1 GCS/O d-pu s-:+++ a+ C+++ UL+++ P- L++ E--- W+++ N o-- K--?
Contact/contact/Mon, 01 Jan 0001 00:00:00 +0000/contact/Email: jeff@thoughtlogix.com Name: Email: Message: Send
Full Stack Developer and Engineer/resume/Mon, 01 Jan 0001 00:00:00 +0000/resume/Over 15 years of software development and IT management experience working with desktop, full stack, front end and server development. Extensive management of build systems, continuous integrations, automated desktop deployments, enterprise servers deployments and customer workflow integration. Objective Experienced software developer and IT manager with detailed knowledge of all aspects of software development and deployment looking to expand role as full stack developer with DevOps emphasis. Ideally looking to join small team with big ideas.
Projects/projects/Mon, 01 Jan 0001 00:00:00 +0000/projects/dotSynergy Application Platform dotSynergy is a platform providing common functionality such as cms and e-commerce as well as custom app integration. This multi-tenant distributed application includes the following features: multi-tenant with user and permission management multi-domain cms functionality including pages, blogs, news, events, bookmarks, publications, stores and more auditing and reverting simple bootstrap or more modern vue based administrative control panels dynamic template support for user-generated pages (i.e. custom homepage template with dynamic elements or layout) custom code integrated into default admin dashboards The tech stack includes nginx load balancers, sparkjava, hibernate, kotlin, postgres, bootstrap, vue.
